experience.title: Head of Product - Candidate Engagement
experience.description: Leading the candidate engagement charter at Apna, a professional network for the rising workforce. Managing a team of product managers to drive engagement and retention. I spent a lot of time at ShareChat envious of the power of a people network - and saw the opportunity at Apna to build a people powered network which would help the emerging workforce (Bharat consumer). To this end I  built multiple products* Digital Professional Identity through an profile valuable to recruiters and the network* Core of the professional network - People You May Know (machine learning based people recommendations)* Content Feed - Personalised content recommended by a data science algorithm. Managed the AI product team.* Job Referral - Use your professional network to identify unlisted/new opportunities. Enabled through a one click referral product tailor made for this audience. Increased chat volume 2x.People Management* Team of ~15 product managers and designers, supported by an engineering team of ~40
experience.description_html: Leading the candidate engagement charter at Apna, a professional network for the rising workforce. Managing a team of product managers to drive engagement and retention. Increased chat volume 2x.People Management* Team of ~15 product managers and designers, supported by an engineering team of ~40

experience.title: Director of Product Management
experience.description: What an absolutely wild ride. 5mn to 50mn daily active users, 0 to xx cr per month in live audio virtual gifting revenue, and launching a market leader short video product overnight.I had more highlights in 3 years than most people have in 30. Experienced absolutes - from the troughs of despair to the highs of success. Went from an IC PM to building and leading a fantastic team of product leaders. I had to build a lot of my own frameworks from first principles - building consumer product in India for a Tier 2 audience is very very different. Personal thesis of exponential learning played out massively. Extremely grateful for the opportunity and the team.At ShareChat I helped scale the product to 100mn+ monthly active users. ShareChat is used by 1 in 5 of internet users in India. I led a team of 20+ GPMs, PMs, and analysts, and ran 5 product pods.I also built India's largest live audio platform specifically for the India 2 audience and grew it from from 0 to xx mn USD GMV in 12 months.A snapshot of products I worked on - * AI Recommendation systems* Live Audio chatrooms (largest audio product in India)* Content creation tools and funnels* Creator acquisition and retention* Notifications (xx bn notifications sent daily)* Search and Discovery* Profile* ShareChat TV (Long form video within ShareChat)and much more.
experience.description_html: What an absolutely wild ride. 5mn to 50mn daily active users, 0 to xx cr per month in live audio virtual gifting revenue, and launching a market leader short video product overnight.I had more highlights in 3 years than most people have in 30. Experienced absolutes - from the troughs of despair to the highs of success. Went from an IC PM to building and leading a fantastic team of product leaders. I had to build a lot of my own frameworks from first principles - building consumer product in India for a Tier 2 audience is very very different. experience.title: Product Manager (Growth, Personalization, Mobile, Video Reviews, Platform)
experience.description: Got my first shot at structured product management. Spent two years here honing my craft, understanding and building for the 'inspiration' part of a travellers customer journey. Managed a couple of junior PMs, built interesting products in content, video, ad-tech.- Programmatic CRM: Built content personalization engine to deliver relevant travel content to 4 million travelers. Involved user journey creation, Facebook integration & marketing, Email marketing, & content mining from reviews.- Video: My team pioneered user generated Video Reviews as a new content format in the travel space. I was responsible for both review generation and review consumption metrics. Being an early leader in Video content meant that I had the chance to see first hand the impact of visual content on all metrics.- Reviews Platform: Led relationship with multiple partners to collect & distribute HolidayIQ review content.- Brand Solutions: Responsible for building out products to amplify HolidayIQ’s Brand Solutions business.Eventually saw my learning plateau and moved. By this time I was sure of consumer product, and was looking to move into a sector which was just opening up. That's when ShareChat happened - content + product + large unaddressed base + rapid growth.
experience.description_html: Got my first shot at structured product management. Spent two years here honing my craft, understanding and building for the 'inspiration' part of a travellers customer journey. By this time I was sure of consumer product, and was looking to move into a sector which was just opening up. That's when ShareChat happened - content + product + large unaddressed base + rapid growth.

experience.title: Growth
experience.description: What Cubeit does -  part of a small team at an Accel Partners funded startup, I helped ideate and launch a content first mobile first app which enabled consumption of diverse forms of content on the mobile (think of how youtube links show in WhatsApp as content cards). As Growth lead I worked on innovative modes of customer acquisition, generating user feedback through AB tests, focus groups, and interviews. Cubeit was eventually acquired by Myntra.Great experience building a 0-1 product, launching, and failing. By now I was a 100% sure I wanted to work as a product manager, but in a slightly more structured organisation. On to the next!
experience.description_html: What Cubeit does -  part of a small team at an Accel Partners funded startup, I helped ideate and launch a content first mobile first app which enabled consumption of diverse forms of content on the mobile (think of how youtube links show in WhatsApp as content cards). As Growth lead I worked on innovative modes of customer acquisition, generating user feedback through AB tests, focus groups, and interviews. Cubeit was eventually acquired by Myntra.Great experience building a 0-1 product, launching, and failing. By now I was a 100% sure I wanted to work as a product manager, but in a slightly more structured organisation. On to the next!

experience.title: Marketing and Business Development
experience.description: At Zoomcar, a Sequoia/Ford funded self drive car rental startup, I was responsible for marketing and business development, my first customer facing role! Ran around setting up parking locations for our cars, helping launch new cities, working on marketing collateral, and a bunch of other generalist stuff.Also - cut my teeth in product, working with the engineering and design team to build products for marketing automation.Another step towards figuring out what I really wanted to do with my career. Outcome: Startups = Good, Product = Great!I quit in 6 months to join a VC funded 5 member team building a content product out of a shared apartment (!)
experience.description_html: At Zoomcar, a Sequoia/Ford funded self drive car rental startup, I was responsible for marketing and business development, my first customer facing role! Ran around setting up parking locations for our cars, helping launch new cities, working on marketing collateral, and a bunch of other generalist stuff.Also - cut my teeth in product, working with the engineering and design team to build products for marketing automation.Another step towards figuring out what I really wanted to do with my career. Outcome: Startups = Good, Product = Great!I quit in 6 months to join a VC funded 5 member team building a content product out of a shared apartment (!)

experience.title: Supply Chain Finance
experience.description: I joined Flipkart as a management trainee in Supply Chain Finance, and was part of the team which managed warehouse finance for Flipkart. This involved tracking costs for all warehouses across India, and actively analyzing them to recommend actions to management. I was also part of the supply chain strategy team where we built a business case for pan India expansion of Flipkart's fulfilment network. Had an opportunity to work on the initial structure of Flipkart First.Flipkart was my first exposure to a fast growing startup, and I liked what I saw! But after 6 months I was pretty sure I didn't want to spend my career neck deep in excel sheets (this was why I stayed away from banking post MBA). Took a risk and quit in 6 months to join an early stage startup in a more customer facing role.
experience.description_html: I joined Flipkart as a management trainee in Supply Chain Finance, and was part of the team which managed warehouse finance for Flipkart. This involved tracking costs for all warehouses across India, and actively analyzing them to recommend actions to management. Had an opportunity to work on the initial structure of Flipkart First.Flipkart was my first exposure to a fast growing startup, and I liked what I saw! But after 6 months I was pretty sure I didn't want to spend my career neck deep in excel sheets (this was why I stayed away from banking post MBA). Took a risk and quit in 6 months to join an early stage startup in a more customer facing role.

experience.title: Analyst, Balance Sheet Management
experience.description: Summer Intern at Balance Sheet Management (Treasury). Worked with internal analytics team on weekly regional projections, and with the Investments desk on building a portfolio analytics suite.Did a bunch of excel and number crunching, explored Hong Kong, and then realised that banking was not for me. So now what?

experience.title: Analyst
experience.description: Separately - my first job was in Singapore, for someone who had never traveled abroad this was a dream come true! Spent 2 years learning a little bit about banking and a lot about why tech is important.DetailsAnalyst, US Fixed Income Technology: I was part of a team of engineers building and maintaining an in house application which acts as a hub between Fixed Income trading applications and a third party vendor application. My team was the touch point for all Fixed Income trades done in the US market on US dollar securities. My role involved analyzing requests for trade/system related information from traders and the middle office, and providing timely and accurate solutions. Tools: SQL, Perl, UNIX.
experience.description_html: Separately - my first job was in Singapore, for someone who had never traveled abroad this was a dream come true! Spent 2 years learning a little bit about banking and a lot about why tech is important.DetailsAnalyst, US Fixed Income Technology: I was part of a team of engineers building and maintaining an in house application which acts as a hub between Fixed Income trading applications and a third party vendor application. My team was the touch point for all Fixed Income trades done in the US market on US dollar securities. My role involved analyzing requests for trade/system related information from traders and the middle office, and providing timely and accurate solutions. Tools: SQL, Perl, UNIX.

experience.title: Editorial Team
experience.description: Combining both my passion for writing, and a desire to work in the social sector, I lead the editorial team at Grassroutes. From the Grassroutes website - Grassroutes is a Fellowship Program which enables outstanding and passionate youth to travel across rural India, discover and work with changemakers, do their bit to change the world and inspire more youth into social action.The editorial team works with Grassroutes fellows to hone their story telling skills, enabling them to get potent, human stories out to the general public, and also facilitates the spread of these stories through mainstream and social media.
experience.description_html: Combining both my passion for writing, and a desire to work in the social sector, I lead the editorial team at Grassroutes. From the Grassroutes website - Grassroutes is a Fellowship Program which enables outstanding and passionate youth to travel across rural India, discover and work with changemakers, do their bit to change the world and inspire more youth into social action.The editorial team works with Grassroutes fellows to hone their story telling skills, enabling them to get potent, human stories out to the general public, and also facilitates the spread of these stories through mainstream and social media.

experience.title: Editor
experience.description: Wrote a bunch of articles for a student run newspaper, where we actually printed and distributed hard copies throughout campus. Yes, I'm that old. Talk to me about the death of newspaper advertising.Led a team of 30 that published 5000 copies of the campus newspaper every fortnight.- Revamped the website and mailing list, resulting in our issues reaching over 5000 alumni worldwide, and the website averaging 10,000 hits a month.- Initiated content collaboration with campus newspapers in IIT Bombay and Delhi, and with the technology magazine Digit.- Comprehensive coverage of campus events has led to reports from The Scholars’ Avenue being quoted in The Indian Express and The Hindustan Times.- First hand experience in newspaper layout using CorelDraw and Photoshop

experience.company: The Scholars' Avenue, Campus newspaper IIT Kharagpur

experience.title: Summer Analyst
experience.description: Analyst in the Asia Pacific IT COO's office. The team's work dealt primarily with administration and reporting for all Technology teams in Asia Pacific.

experience.title: Summer Intern
experience.description: Worked under Prof. Sanghamitra Das on a Government of India Sponsored Project to assess the environmental impact of poverty using evidence from firewood use in rural India. Recommendations were acknowledged in the publication.

education.title: Indian Institute of Management, Bangalore
education.description: Spent two years on a beautiful campus, did some off beat courses, made life long friendships, broke a leg, spent 3 months studying abroad, and did not learn too much about management. On the side, co-authored a book on entrepreneurship along with 25 other IIM students "Small Big Bang"

education.title: Louvain School of Management
education.description: Attended Louvain School of Management, Belgium for three months as an exchange student. Backpacked through 5 countries and 15 cities experiencing broke student life before losing my passport in Switzerland (very DDLJ ish when you think about it), and almost getting deported. Also did a bunch of courses in International finance.

education.title: Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur
education.description: Activities and Societies: Debate, Dramatics, The Scholars' Avenue (campus newspaper), Soccer, Quiz Spent 5 years preparing for life in a sheltered campus in the middle of nowhere, made friends for life, did tons of things I thought I'd never do - performed a musical, led large teams of students in theatre competitions, played competitive football, water polo, interned at an investment bank abroad, and got a job At the end of it all, graduated with a degree in Mathematics.
education.description_html: Activities and Societies: Debate, Dramatics, The Scholars' Avenue (campus newspaper), Soccer, Quiz

education.title: Don Bosco School, New Delhi
education.description: Activities and Societies: Debate team, Quiz team, Editor for School Magazine. • Awarded Reynolds Scholarship 2005, 1 of 2 recipients among class 12 students in Delhi, for all round excellence • Ranked 42 in Delhi, 268 in India at National Cyber Olympiad 2005, among Class 12 students across India • Awarded CBSE Merit Scholarship 2005, for outstanding performance in AISSCE 2005 (ranked 6 in Delhi) • Best Bosconian 2005, awarded to the best student upon graduation from high school, for all round excellence
education.description_html: Activities and Societies: Debate team, Quiz team, Editor for School Magazine.

courses: [{"subtitle":"-","title":"Artificial Intelligence for Managers"},{"subtitle":"-","title":"Banking, Financial Markets & Systems"},{"subtitle":"-","title":"Competition & Strategy"},{"subtitle":"-","title":"Computational Statistics"},{"subtitle":"-","title":"Creative Marketing"},{"subtitle":"-","title":"Design and analysis of algorithms"},{"subtitle":"-","title":"Equity and Fixed Income"},{"subtitle":"-","title":"Financial Derivatives"},{"subtitle":"-","title":"International Accounting Standards"},{"subtitle":"-","title":"International Finance"},{"subtitle":"-","title":"International Macroeconomics"},{"subtitle":"-","title":"Portfolio Management"},{"subtitle":"-","title":"Probability and Statistics"},{"subtitle":"-","title":"Time Series Analysis"}]
publications: [{"title":"Social Media In Politics","subtitle":"Tejas, Indian Institute of Management Bangalore's Management Review","date":"January 3, 2014","description":"Though the applications of social media in the business sphere are huge and well tapped, the use of the internet in political campaigns is a fairly recent development. This article aims to create a cohesive strategy for a hypothetical election candidate in a big Indian urban centre with a significant youth population. This articles highlights the do’s and do not’s when it comes to reaching out to voters using social media.Through this report, we draw on Aristotle’s theory of ‘Rhetoric’, which classifies modes of persuasion. Along with this theory, we also draw on case studies of successful social media campaigns in the spheres of elections and public interest, including Barack Obama’s 2012 campaign and India against Corruption’s large scale movement for anti-corruption legislation."}]
